results.title: The Meiji adventure
results.creator_credit: Bill Steller, Australia-Japan Foundation and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Journey into Japan”.
Presenter, Keith Adam, describes Japan’s leap from feudal outpost to modern nation by recounting the history of the Meiji dynasty that led to this amazing social transformation.

results.title: Fuji, thirty seven views
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Journey into Japan”.
Once a sacred Shinto site that drew devout pilgrims, Fuji is seen to be ringed by polluting industries, littered with trash, and topped by crassly commercial souvenir stands and fast food sheds. For residents of Tokyo, Fuji used to be a daily sight; today, because of the smog, they rarely see it. Later as he explores Tokyo, Keith Adam muses on how industrial development has cut the people off from more than just the sight of Fuji but also from what it once stood for. Shinto traditions have disappeared into pragmatic secularism; close-knit, communal neighbourhoods have given way to cramped, impersonal high-rise apartments, agricultural land and open spaces are being overwhelmed by industrial plants that pollute without thought for the future. Narrated by Keith Adam.

results.title: A Brush with nature, Robert Ulmann
results.creator_credit: Toni Steinbrecher, ABC-TV (Australia). Natural History Unit and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Animal passions”.
The return of the southern right whale to Australia’s southern coast is observed and recorded in the art of Swiss-Australian wildlife artist, Robert Ulmann. He has found a new life in an area that most Australians would avoid as desolate, dangerous and bleak.

results.creator_credit: John Muirhead, Dione Gilmour and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Animal passions”.
An examination of the feeding and habitat of the koala, the likely survival of the species in the face of environmental and biological threats is discussed.

results.title: Secrets of the heart
results.creator_credit: Edwin Hill and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Animal passions”.
Narrated by Richard Morecroft and presented by Steve Morton, this beautifully photographed documentary takes a critical look at the “dead heart” of Australia, the desert areas of the Northern Territory. They are revealed as a complex and subtle environment under threat from cattle grazing and poor land management techniques.

results.title: Tchaikovsky: Public triumph... personal despair
results.creator_credit: Graham Holloway, Bob Carruthers, Beckmann and Cromwell Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Music maestro”.
Adoring audiences, international acclaim and an independent fortune should have made Tchaikovsky a happy man. Unfortunatley they seemed only to add to the secret anguish of a tortured soul hiding dark secrets from the stifling high society of 19th Century Russia. Innovative and informative, this program explores the character of the man and builds a picture of his life and times. Using feature films inserts, stunning period images and a masterful narrative by conductor/composer David Palmer, combined with superb performances by internationally renowned artists, this is an unforgettable record of the life of one of the world’s great composers. Featuring performances of such classics as: 1812 Overture, excerpts from Swan Lake, The Nutcracker Suite, the Slavonic March and more.

results.title: Holiday
results.brief_description: From ABC Television’s award-winning and popularly acclaimed travel program ‘Holiday’ comes a series of eight fabulous videos covering every facet of holidaying in the states and territories of Australia. Whether you’re looking for a luxury five star resort or the chance to get off the beaten track, this series has got Australia covered.
